revised_title: Action of Bisulphide of Carbon on Triethylphosphine: A New Compound and Its Properties
tldr: A. W. Hofmann investigates the reaction between bisulphide of carbon and triethylphosphine, resulting in a new crimson-colored compound. The substance is insoluble in water and ether but soluble in alcohol. It has potential applications in chemical analysis and detection of trace amounts of triethylphosphine.
